key_channel_insights.line_content: 83% of itineraries have identical pricing between the OTA and the airline's website, indicating overall stability.
MSE channel offers lower prices on 74.28% of itineraries, with short-haul routes benefitting the most.
GDS channel shows higher prices than the airline's website in 72.85% of cases, reflecting significant markups.

conclusion.line_content: This report provides a high-level summary of the price discrepancies observed across different channels.  It is important to note that the data contains many nuances depending on various factors such as market conditions, booking windows, and the competitive landscape. Understanding these subtleties can be critical in optimizing pricing strategies and ensuring competitive positioning.

As part of our 'PriceEye' solution, we are developing an intuitive dashboard designed to help your airline's analysts drill down into this data. This tool will allow you to uncover and focus on critical actionable insights, enabling your team to make data-driven decisions with confidence.

We are here to support you in leveraging these insights to enhance your revenue management and distribution strategies. Please don't hesitate to connect with our team for more information about how PriceEye can assist you in achieving your business objectives.

ota_highlights.line_content: Over the latest week, 83% of analyzed itineraries reflected identical pricing between the airline's site and OTA.

ota_highlights.line_title: OTA Prices Higher for Fewer Offers
ota_highlights.line_content: While a minor percentage (around 2%) of OTA fares were higher than the airline's site fares during the review period, this occurred consistently across all time comparisons.

ota_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: The frequency of website offers not found through the OTA channel increased by over 7% month-on-month, indicating a potential issue in OTA coverage.
OTAs offered higher prices in about 2% of instances; this status has remained relatively stable across weeks and months.

ota_summary_by_region.line_content: On short haul routes, 83% of prices were the same on OTAs as on the airline site, aligning with the overall pricing trend.

ota_summary_by_region.line_title: Long Haul Increasing OTA Prices Higher
ota_summary_by_region.line_content: Long haul routes showed slightly more frequent higher prices on OTAs than short haul, though overall percentages remained low.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: For Non-ES origin countries, 85% of itineraries had same pricing on OTAs and the airline's site, showcasing pricing stability.

ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_title: ES Markets Prone to Pricing Variability
ota_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: OTA coverage of ES origin markets showed 14% of offers not found, with slight increases in higher price incidences.

ota_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: Close-in bookings showed a 0.6% downward month-on-month change in lower OTA pricing instances, although these were already few.
Far-out bookings had a relatively high same-price ratio at 91%, but exhibited minor fluctuations, particularly in lowered OTA offers over the month.

mse_highlights.line_content: Pricing is predominantly lower on MSE than Iberia's own site, especially in short haul; 74.28% of all itineraries were cheaper over the last week.
The incidence of Iberia's offers not appearing on MSE has increased over the past month, with a notable 6.20% rise overall.

mse_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: Instances of MSE not listing offers rose 6.20% over the past month, hinting at coverage gaps.
The consistency of same pricing has slightly increased by 3.86% from the previous month, maintaining stability.

mse_summary_by_region.line_content: Pricing for short haul is largely cheaper on MSE, with a 78.74% occurrence rate last week compared to the Iberia site.
Long haul also sees lower MSE pricing, though at a lesser rate, with 26.11% of instances cheaper last week.

mse_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: Flights originating from Spain have a higher frequency of lower prices on MSE, showing a 76.04% rate of lower pricing last week compared to non-Spanish origins.
Non-Spanish origins had fewer instances of price differences, but still, 67.17% were lower on MSE last week.

mse_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: The close-in booking window saw 70.05% of itineraries cheaper on MSE last week, maintaining a strong lower price advantage.
Far out bookings showed a pronounced disparity, with 82.94% cheaper on MSE last week, though the frequency decreased compared to closer bookings.

gds_highlights.line_content: Over 70% of rates in the GDS channel are higher than those on the airline's website, indicating frequent price disparities.
The percentage of GDS prices lower than website prices remains steady over the period analyzed, suggesting consistent, albeit rare, GDS discounts.

gds_summary_high_level_comparison.line_content: GDS channel displays higher pricing 72.85% of the time versus the airline website, slightly down by 0.76% from the previous week.
The frequency of identical pricing between GDS and the website is negligible across all dimensions, highlighting the need for strategic alignment.

gds_summary_by_region.line_content: For short-haul itineraries, GDS prices are higher 72.38% on average, showing minor week-to-week fluctuation.

gds_summary_by_region.line_title: Long Haul GDS Rates Extremely High
gds_summary_by_region.line_content: Long-haul GDS rates exceed the airline prices 77.97% of the time, indicating a significant markup compared to website listings.

gds_summary_by_point_of_origin.line_content: GDS prices are higher for flights originating in Spain approximately 70.23% of the time, slightly reduced by 0.75% from last week.
Non-Spanish origin flights see even higher GDS pricing at 83.40%, narrowing slightly over time.

gds_summary_by_booking_window.line_content: GDS prices for close-in bookings are higher about 71% of the time, though showing a slight 0.08% increase over last week.
For far-out bookings, 76.50% of the itineraries have higher GDS rates compared to the website, with minimal week-to-week changes.
